messages.message:
> Does not work:
> *Extract* the consolidated statement of comprehensive income from this document as a table
> Does work:
> *Return* the consolidated statement of comprehensive income from this document as a table
@Matt Weaver even for the second one I think it’s not correct
Anyways, it’s purely a model decision. I may suspect that `Extract` might suggest that the model is meant to return the information as it is and given that model get the INPUT_COL which is a pure text with some spacings it didn’t get that there is a table in there
`Return .. as table` might indicate that model need to transform input on the fly

e.g. it was working for me when I used this
`Extract the statement of comprehensive income as a table. Parse the input text and use a markdown format as an output.`

> i wonder if there’s a way we can improve this user experience?
we were thinking about adding one more step to ask the model to improve the user prompt
but that could also backfire at us as we won’t give so much flexibility to the user
But let us experiment a bit and check what are the scores if we apply such a step
